text.text: How do I enable multi-company management (MCM) to effectively manage billing operations for multiple companies?

text: Multi-Company Management (MCM) enables billing service providers to effectively manage billing operations for one or multiple companies. With MCM, it's easy to share data sets such as payers and facilities and work on claims across your client base.

text.text: What is the role of a parent company in the context of multi-company management (MCM)?

text: A parent company is a company that provides billing services for other companies. A child company is a company that outsourced their medical billing operations to a billing service (parent company). In MCM, a link is created between a parent and child company. The Multi-company management tab gives you the ability to link facilities and payers configured on the parent company to one or more child companies.

text.text: Can you explain the concept of a child company in multi-company management?

text: A child company is a company that outsourced their medical billing operations to a billing service (parent company). In MCM, a link is created between a parent and child company. The Multi-company management tab gives you the ability to link facilities and payers configured on the parent company to one or more child companies.

text.text: What does it mean when two entities are linked in MCM?

text: Linking is a software connection between two entities. A linked icon indicates that there is a software connection between the parent and child. Once linked, an exact duplicate of the record will be displayed on both the parent and child company's facilities and payer pages.

text.text: Where can I view a list of linked child companies from the parent company's perspective?

text: You can view a list of linked child companies by clicking on the Settings option in the navigation bar, followed by the Multi-company management tab. All linked children will be displayed at the top of this page.

text.text: How do I access the Multi-company management tab in Settings to link facilities and payers to child companies?

text: To use the Multi-company management tab, you need to click Settings on the navigation bar and then click the Multi-company management tab. All child companies are selected by default. If you are linking facilities or payers specific children, uncheck the Select all box and then check the box next to the appropriate child names.

text.text: What steps are involved in linking facilities and payers from the parent company to child companies?

text: The steps involved in linking facilities and payers from the parent company to child companies are: 1. Click Settings on the navigation bar and then click the Multi-company management tab. 2. All child companies are selected by default. If you are linking facilities or payers specific children, uncheck the Select all box and then check the box next to the appropriate child names. 3. Click either the Facilities or Payers tab. 4. Click the top check box to select all payers or facilities. To select individual payers or facilities, click the box to the left of the name. 5. Click Save linking. A copy of the record now displays in the child company and is linked to the parent company.

text.text: How can I identify linked payers and facilities in the Multi-company management tab?

text: The configured facilities and payers can be found under the Facilities and Payers tab as a list.

text.text: What indicators signify that a payer or facility is linked to selected child companies?

text: A linked icon in front of the payer or facility name indicates that it is linked to one or more child companies. This indicator only displays if all selected child companies have that payer or facility. If multiple child companies are selected and one of the child companies is not linked to the payer or facility, then that payer/facility will not display the linked indicator.

text.text: What are some important considerations when linking or copying facility and payer records from the parent company to child companies?

text: If you make changes to a linked facility or a payer in the child company, that record will no longer be linked except in the following instances:

text.text: As a Company Administrator, what is my role in configuring payers and facilities at the parent level for multi-company management?

text: As a Company Administrator, you can manage payers and facilities at the parent level. You can create, edit, delete, and copy payers and facilities. You can also link facilities and payers configured on the parent company to one or more child companies.

text.text: How can I manage payers and facilities specific to each child company within the multi-company management framework?

text: As a Company Administrator, you can manage payers and facilities specific to each child company. You can create, edit, delete, and copy payers and facilities. You can also link facilities and payers configured on the parent company to one or more child companies.

text.text: How can I manage payers and facilities specific to each child company within the multi-company management framework?

text: You can also use the context switcher to access the child company and make the necessary adjustments.

text.text: How do I switch between a parent company and its child companies using the context switcher?

text: The parent company's name is displayed in bold at the top of the context switcher list, followed by the indented names of its children. By viewing the name on the context switcher, you can easily determine which company you are currently working in at any given time.

text.text: What is the significance of the company name displayed in the blue header when accessing a child company through the context switcher?

text: The company name in the blue header does not change when a parent using MCM to accesses a child company. It is very important that you pay attention to the name that displays in the context switcher as that will tell you which company you are in.

text.text: What actions can be taken to modify linked facilities at the parent level?

text: Only Company Administrators can modify a facility at the parent level. Updates made for a facility at the parent level will also update the facility record for all linked child companies.

text.text: Who has the authority to modify a linked payer at the parent level, and how is it done?

text: Only Company Administrators can modify a payer at the parent level. To modify a linked payer at the parent level, click Payers on the navigation bar.

text.text: Can you explain how to add a new payer at the parent level and copy it to selected child companies?

text: Adding a new payer can be done by a Company Administrator at the parent level by clicking Payers on the navigation bar. On the Payers page, click Add a payer. The name of child companies that are linked to the parent company displays on the bottom of the page. By default they are all selected. Enter the payer name and other pertinent information. Now you decide which child to copy the record to. On the bottom of the page you will see a that the child companies that are linked to the parent companies are all selected by default. If you do not want to copy this new payer to all the children, click 'Select all' and then select the boxes next to one or more child company names. Click Save.

text.text: What steps are involved in adding a new facility at the parent level and copying it to specific child companies?

text: Adding a new facility can be done by a Company Administrator on the parent level by clicking Facilities on the navigation bar. On the Facilities page, click Add a facility. The name of all child companies that are linked to the parent company displays on the bottom of the New Facility page. By default they are all selected. Enter the facility name and other pertinent information. Now select which child to copy the record to. On the bottom of the page you will see that all the companies are selected by default. If you do not want to copy this new facility to all the children, click 'Select all' and then select the boxes next to one or more child company names. Click Save.

text.text: How are allowable amounts managed for payers within the multi-company management framework?

text: Allowable amounts are unique per company and cannot be linked from a parent record. To manage allowable amounts for a particular payer, use the context switcher to access the child company and make the necessary adjustments.

text.text: What actions are taken to manage contracted charges for facilities in multi-company management?

text: To manage contracted charges for a particular facility, use the context switcher to access the child company and make the necessary adjustments. You can also use the context switcher to work in a child account.

text.text: How do I work within a child account using the context switcher?

text: To work within a child account, use the context switcher to click the name of the child company. You will land on the Dashboard for that child company.

text.text: What is the process for returning to the parent company or switching to another child company from within a child account?

text: To return to the parent company, or to move to another child company, click the context switcher and select the name from the list. You will land on the Dashboard for that child company.

text.text: Can you explain how facilities and payers are disabled or enabled at the parent level and its impact on child companies?

text: Payers and facilities that are disabled at the parent level by a Customer Administrator will be disabled in all the child companies with a linked record.

text.text: How do I disable a payer or facility at the parent level, and what effect does it have on linked child companies?

text: Payers and facilities that are disabled at the parent level by a Customer Administrator will be disabled in all the child companies with a linked record.

text.text: If a payer or facility is disabled at the parent level, will it be disabled in all linked child companies automatically?

text: Yes, if a payer or facility is disabled at the parent level, it will be disabled in all linked child companies automatically.

text.text: What measures should be taken if I want to re-enable a disabled payer or facility at the parent level?

text: To re-enable a disabled payer or facility at the parent level, you can click the dash under the Enabled column. The dash will change into a check mark to indicate that the plan is now enabled.

text.text: How does the system handle changes made to linked records at the child level in multi-company management?

text: If you make changes to a linked facility or a payer in the child company, that record will no longer be linked except in the following instances:

text.text: Can you describe the process for restoring linkage if it is broken due to changes made at the child level?

text: If the linkage is broken, you can easily restore it by accessing the "Multi-company management" tab in Settings and copying the record down to the child company again.

text.text: What are some potential issues to watch out for when managing linked records between parent and child companies in multi-company management?

text:
When managing linked records between parent and child companies in multi-company management, there are a few potential issues to watch out for. First, it is important to make sure that the correct records are being linked. This can be done by checking the "Linked" column in the "Multi-company management" tab in Settings. If a record is not linked, it will not be updated when changes are made to the parent record.
Second, it is important to be aware of the limitations of multi-company management. For example, some features, such as payment plans and discounts, cannot be linked between parent and child companies.
Finally, it is important to keep in mind that changes made to a linked record at the child level will not be reflected in the parent record. This means that it is important to make sure that all changes are made to the parent record first, and then to the child records.

text.text: how can i know if a link is successful?

text: If the linking was successful , a green message displays. If no facilities / payers were linked or created , a yellow warning message displays.

text.text: explain the relationship between Payer's allowable amounts and facility's contracted charges

text: Payer's allowable amounts and facility's contracted charges can be different between the parent and child companies without breaking the linkage. If they are set up at the parent level, they won't be automatically copied to the child company.
